documents.content: Claim submitted by Mountain Peak Neurology for patient Gerald Kovac (ID PT-8872-3A) for specialized cognitive therapy sessions during 02/2024. Documentation includes referral from Dr. Emilia Torres at Summit Valley Hospital and prior authorization number PA-6653-9B. Patient diagnosed with early-onset Lewy body dementia and REM sleep behavior disorder.

Research protocol memo from Colorado Neurodegenerative Institute detailing participation criteria for study CNI-228 (Lewy spectrum disorders). Includes Gerald Kovac's screening results showing unusual treatment response pattern to cholinesterase inhibitors. Study coordinator: Lydia Marnell (lydia.marnell@cni-research.co), IRB approval expires 10/15/2025.

Internal audit of neurocognitive claims at Blue Horizon Insurance identified 43% increase in pre-authorization requests for Lewy body dementia treatments in Q1 2024. Notable case: PT-8872-3A required three peer-to-peer reviews due to combination therapy protocol. Regional manager: Arjun Patel (303-555-0187).

News article in Boulder Medical Times: 'Breakthrough in Dementia Care Coverage' mentions new state mandate requiring coverage for multi-modal therapies. Features patient story referencing Mountain Peak Neurology case with unusual sleep study findings (patient declined to be named but matches clinical details from PT-8872-3A).

metadata.content_summary: Patient Gerald Kovac's complex neurological care journey intersecting with specialized claims processing, clinical research participation, and policy changes regarding dementia treatments

questions.q: Which two neurological conditions does Gerald Kovac (PT-8872-3A) have according to his Mountain Peak Neurology claim?
questions.a: Early-onset Lewy body dementia and REM sleep behavior disorder.

questions.q: What percentage increase in pre-authorization requests for Lewy body dementia treatments did Blue Horizon's audit find in Q1 2024?
What study number and unusual clinical feature are documented for Gerald Kovac's participation in Colorado Neurodegenerative Institute research?
questions.a: Study CNI-228 showed unusual treatment response to cholinesterase inhibitors.

questions.q: How do the Boulder Medical Times article and audit report collectively highlight changes in dementia care coverage?
questions.a: New state mandates require multi-modal therapy coverage following increased pre-authorization requests.
